--- title: "What We Know and What We Don't" --- > *For every known, the math gives the same answer every time. For every unknown, QIF assigns a variable — so when science fills in the value, the equation already works.* ## The Knowns: Established Science QIF Builds On These 21 equations and facts form the foundation of QIF. Every one is established science — peer-reviewed, experimentally validated, and universally accepted. ::: {#tbl-knowns .cell tbl-cap='Established Science Used in QIF' execution_count=2} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=2} ```{=html}
Known Fact Equation/Principle QIF Uses It For Status
0 Signals have timing jitter Phase variance σ²ᵩ Coherence metric (Cₛ) Established
1 Signals degrade over pathways Transport variance σ²τ Coherence metric (Cₛ) Established
2 Amplitude fluctuates Gain variance σ²ᵧ Coherence metric (Cₛ) Established
3 Ion channels have voltage gates Hodgkin-Huxley (1952) Classical BCI security Established
4 Ions have equilibrium potentials Nernst (1889) Tissue modeling Established
5 Ion flux depends on gradients Nernst-Planck Interface physics Established
6 Channels have bandwidth limits Shannon capacity (1948) Signal integrity Established
7 Thermal noise follows statistics Boltzmann distribution Noise modeling Established
8 Signals decompose into frequencies Fourier transform Oscillatory analysis Established
9 Tissue has frequency-dependent impedance Cole-Cole dispersion Electrode modeling Established
10 Electric fields in tissue follow Poisson Quasi-static Poisson Volume conduction Established
11 Particles tunnel through barriers T ≈ e^(−2κd) Vulnerability + biometric Established
12 Quantum states can't be copied No-cloning theorem (1982) Anti-spoofing Established
13 Measurement disturbs quantum states Heisenberg uncertainty (1927) Eavesdrop detection Established
14 Generalized uncertainty has exact form Robertson-Schrödinger (1929) Indeterminacy computation Established
15 Quantum probability from wave function Born rule (1926) State measurement Established
16 Mixed state uncertainty is quantifiable Von Neumann entropy (1932) Quantum security scoring Established
17 Entangled pairs are correlated Bell states (1964) QKD security Established
18 Frequent measurement freezes evolution Quantum Zeno effect (1977) Zeno-BCI hypothesis Established
19 Quantum factoring is efficient Shor's algorithm O(n³) (1994) Crypto threat Established
20 Quantum search is optimal Grover's algorithm O(√N) (1996) Crypto threat Established
``` ::: ::: ## The Unknowns: Where QIF Fills the Gap These 8 open questions are where QIF makes its contribution. Rather than guessing the answers, QIF assigns each unknown a mathematical variable — the equation works regardless. ::: {#tbl-unknowns .cell tbl-cap='Open Questions Modeled as QIF Variables' execution_count=3} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=3} ```{=html}
Unknown The Mystery QIF's Approach Variable
0 Decoherence time in neural tissue 10⁻¹³ s vs 10⁻⁵ s vs hours (8 OOM disagreement) Tunable parameter τ_D
1 Does the brain use entanglement? Fisher's Posner molecules — unverified Model both biological + artificial Qentangle
2 Quantum indeterminacy at BCI interface No one has quantified it Central QI variable Qi
3 Ion channel tunneling uniqueness Are profiles unique per person? Quantum biometric hypothesis Qtunnel (biometric)
4 Does BCI sampling stabilize quantum states? Zeno-BCI — never tested Modeled hypothesis Zeno term
5 Davydov soliton vulnerability Can THz radiation trigger false synaptic events? Tunneling vulnerability model Qtunnel (threat)
6 Silicon-tissue quantum boundary No quantum-level framework exists I0 Neural Interface QIF Band I0
7 Classical-quantum transition shape Binary or continuous? Continuous dial: ΓD(t) = 1 − e^(−t/τ_D) ΓD(t)
``` ::: ::: ## The QIF Bridge ::: {#cell-fig-bridge .cell execution_count=4} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![QIF bridges established science and open questions. Knowns enter as constants, unknowns as variables. The equation works regardless of which unknowns get resolved.](03-knowns-unknowns_files/figure-html/fig-bridge-output-1.png){#fig-bridge width=1142 height=566} ::: :::
